instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP3V42_G3H_REG: What is PP3V42_G3H_REG? PP3V42_G3H_REG is another way to say PP3V42_G3H. PP3V42_G3H_REG and PP3V42_G3H are a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: 13 inch macbook pro 820 3115 not switching on, all looks dead.
threads.message:
Not switching on, when connecting power, no green/red light on charge connector. Charge voltage is getting into the board
Found short at <CAPACITOR>C6994</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C6999</CAPACITOR>, removed and shirt still there. Removed <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>, short still there. 
From what I can see on a schematic it should be <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_REG</SIGNAL> coming out of <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>. Where does <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H_REG</SIGNAL>? From what I have found on the schematic it goes to the SMC so am I correct in thinking it is the SMC either failed and shorted to ground or something different?
Thanks

threads.title: 13 inch macbook pro 820 3115 not switching on, all looks dead.
threads.message: Inject voltage on 3V42 bus and see what heats up. Start low and measure current, don't go over 3.4V of course.

threads.title: 13 inch macbook pro 820 3115 not switching on, all looks dead.
threads.message: Bitch, should have though of that already. Will do
